00040 #define SD_UNLIMITED NC_UNLIMITED /* use this as marker for unlimited dimension */
00041 #define SD_NOFILL    NC_NOFILL
00042 #define SD_FILL      NC_FILL
00043 #define SD_DIMVAL_BW_COMP   1
00044 #define SD_DIMVAL_BW_INCOMP  0
00045 #define SD_RAGGED    -1  /* marker for ragged dimension */

00047 /* used to indicate the type of the variable at an index */
00048 typedef struct hdf_varlist
00049 {
00050     int32 var_index;     /* index of the current variable */
00051     hdf_vartype_t var_type; /* type of a variable (IS_SDSVAR, IS_CRDVAR, or UNKNOWN */
00052 } hdf_varlist_t;
00053 
00054 /* enumerated types for various types of ids in SD interface */
00055 typedef enum
00056 {
00057     NOT_SDAPI_ID = -1,  /* not an SD API id */
00058     SD_ID = 0,      /* SD id */
00059     SDS_ID,     /* SDS id */
00060     DIM_ID      /* Dimension id */
00061 } hdf_idtype_t;

00242 /*====================== Chunking Routines ================================*/
00243 
00244 /* For defintion of HDF_CHUNK_DEF union see hproto.h since 
00245    this defintion is also used by GRs. */
00246 
00247 /******************************************************************************
00248  NAME
00249       SDsetchunk   -- make SDS a chunked SDS
00250 
00251  DESCRIPTION
00252       This routine makes the SDS a chunked SDS according to the chunk
00253       definition passed in.
00254 
00255       The dataset currently cannot be special already.  i.e. NBIT,
00256       COMPRESSED, or EXTERNAL. This is an Error.
00257 
00258       The defintion of the HDF_CHUNK_DEF union with relvant fields is:
00259 
00260       typedef union hdf_chunk_def_u
00261       {
00262          int32   chunk_lengths[H4_MAX_VAR_DIMS];  Chunk lengths along each dimension
00263 
00264          struct 
00265           {   
00266             int32     chunk_lengths[H4_MAX_VAR_DIMS]; Chunk lengths along each dimension
00267             int32     comp_type;                   Compression type 
00268             comp_info cinfo;                       Compression info struct 
00269           }comp;
00270 
00271       } HDF_CHUNK_DEF
00272 
00273       The simplist is the 'chunk_lengths' array specifiying chunk 
00274       lengths for each dimension where the 'flags' argument set to 
00275       'HDF_CHUNK';
00276 
00277       COMPRESSION is set by using the 'HDF_CHUNK_DEF' structure to set the
00278       appropriate compression information along with the required chunk lengths
00279       for each dimension. The compression information is the same as 
00280       that set in 'SDsetcompress()'. The bit-or'd'flags' argument' is set to 
00281       'HDF_CHUNK | HDF_COMP'.
00282 
00283       See the example in pseudo-C below for further usage.
00284 
00285       The maximum number of Chunks in an HDF file is 65,535.
00286 
00287       The dataset currently cannot have an UNLIMITED dimension.
00288 
00289       The performance of the SDxxx interface with chunking is greatly
00290       affected by the users access pattern over the dataset and by
00291       the maximum number of chunks set in the chunk cache. The cache contains 
00292       the Least Recently Used(LRU cache replacment policy) chunks. See the
00293       routine SDsetchunkcache() for further info on the chunk cache and how 
00294       to set the maximum number of chunks in the chunk cache. A default chunk 
00295       cache is always created.
00296 
00297       The following example shows the organization of chunks for a 2D array.
00298       e.g. 4x4 array with 2x2 chunks. The array shows the layout of
00299            chunks in the chunk array.
00300 
00301             4 ---------------------                                           
00302               |         |         |                                                 
00303         Y     |  (0,1)  |  (1,1)  |                                       
00304         ^     |         |         |                                      
00305         |   2 ---------------------                                       
00306         |     |         |         |                                               
00307         |     |  (0,0)  |  (1,0)  |                                      
00308         |     |         |         |                                           
00309         |     ---------------------                                         
00310         |     0         2         4                                       
00311         ---------------> X                                                       
00312                                                                                 
00313         --Without compression--:
00314         {                                                                    
00315         HDF_CHUNK_DEF chunk_def;
00316                                                                             
00317         .......                                                                    
00318         -- Set chunk lengths --                                                    
00319         chunk_def.chunk_lengths[0]= 2;                                                     
00320         chunk_def.chunk_lengths[1]= 2; 
00321 
00322         -- Set Chunking -- 
00323         SDsetchunk(sdsid, chunk_def, HDF_CHUNK);                      
00324          ......                                                                  
00325         }                                                                           
00326 
00327         --With compression--:
00328         {                                                                    
00329         HDF_CHUNK_DEF chunk_def;
00330                                                                             
00331         .......                
00332         -- Set chunk lengths first --                                                    
00333         chunk_def.chunk_lengths[0]= 2;                                                     
00334         chunk_def.chunk_lengths[1]= 2;
00335 
00336         -- Set compression --
00337         chunk_def.comp.cinfo.deflate.level = 9;
00338         chunk_def.comp.comp_type = COMP_CODE_DEFLATE;
00339 
00340         -- Set Chunking with Compression --
00341         SDsetchunk(sdsid, chunk_def, HDF_CHUNK | HDF_COMP);                      
00342          ......                                                                  
00343         }                                                                           
00344 
00345  RETURNS
00346         SUCCEED/FAIL
00347 ******************************************************************************/
00348 HDFLIBAPI intn SDsetchunk
00349     (int32 sdsid,             /* IN: sds access id */
00350      HDF_CHUNK_DEF chunk_def, /* IN: chunk definition */
00351      int32 flags              /* IN: flags */);
00352 
00353 /******************************************************************************
00354  NAME
00355      SDgetchunkinfo -- get Info on SDS
00356 
00357  DESCRIPTION
00358      This routine gets any special information on the SDS. If its chunked,
00359      chunked and compressed or just a regular SDS. Currently it will only
00360      fill the array of chunk lengths for each dimension as specified in
00361      the 'HDF_CHUNK_DEF' union. It does not tell you the type of compression
00362      used or the compression parameters. You can pass in a NULL for 'chunk_def'
00363      if don't want the chunk lengths for each dimension.
00364      Additionaly if successfull it will return a bit-or'd value in 'flags' 
00365      indicating if the SDS is:
00366 
00367      Chunked                  -> flags = HDF_CHUNK
00368      Chunked and compressed   -> flags = HDF_CHUNK | HDF_COMP 
00369      Non-chunked              -> flags = HDF_NONE
00370   
00371      e.g. 4x4 array - Pseudo-C
00372      {
00373      int32   rcdims[3];
00374      HDF_CHUNK_DEF rchunk_def;
00375      int32   cflags;
00376      ...
00377      rchunk_def.chunk_lengths = rcdims;
00378      SDgetchunkinfo(sdsid, &rchunk_def, &cflags);
00379      ...
00380      }
00381 
00382  RETURNS
00383         SUCCEED/FAIL
00384 ******************************************************************************/
00385 HDFLIBAPI intn SDgetchunkinfo
00386     (int32 sdsid,              /* IN: sds access id */
00387      HDF_CHUNK_DEF *chunk_def, /* IN/OUT: chunk definition */
00388      int32 *flags              /* IN/OUT: flags */);
00389 
00390 /******************************************************************************
00391  NAME
00392      SDwritechunk  -- write the specified chunk to the SDS
00393 
00394  DESCRIPTION
00395      This routine writes a whole chunk of data to the chunked SDS 
00396      specified by chunk 'origin' for the given SDS and can be used
00397      instead of SDwritedata() when this information is known. This
00398      routine has less overhead and is much faster than using SDwritedata().
00399 
00400      Origin specifies the co-ordinates of the chunk according to the chunk
00401      position in the overall chunk array.
00402 
00403      'datap' must point to a whole chunk of data.
00404 
00405      See SDsetchunk() for a description of the organization of chunks in an SDS.
00406 
00407  RETURNS
00408         SUCCEED/FAIL
00409 ******************************************************************************/
00410 HDFLIBAPI intn SDwritechunk
00411     (int32 sdsid,      /* IN: sds access id */
00412      int32 *origin,    /* IN: origin of chunk to write */
00413      const void *datap /* IN: buffer for data */);
00414 
00415 /******************************************************************************
00416  NAME
00417      SDreadchunk   -- read the specified chunk to the SDS
00418 
00419  DESCRIPTION
00420      This routine reads a whole chunk of data from the chunked SDS
00421      specified by chunk 'origin' for the given SDS and can be used
00422      instead of SDreaddata() when this information is known. This
00423      routine has less overhead and is much faster than using SDreaddata().
00424 
00425      Origin specifies the co-ordinates of the chunk according to the chunk
00426      position in the overall chunk array.
00427 
00428      'datap' must point to a whole chunk of data.
00429 
00430      See SDsetchunk() for a description of the organization of chunks in an SDS.
00431 
00432  RETURNS
00433         SUCCEED/FAIL
00434 ******************************************************************************/
00435 HDFLIBAPI intn SDreadchunk
00436     (int32 sdsid,      /* IN: sds access id */
00437      int32 *origin,    /* IN: origin of chunk to read */
00438      void  *datap      /* IN/OUT: buffer for data */);
00439 
00440 /******************************************************************************
00441 NAME
00442      SDsetchunkcache -- maximum number of chunks to cache 
00443 
00444 DESCRIPTION
00445      Set the maximum number of chunks to cache.
00446 
00447      The cache contains the Least Recently Used(LRU cache replacment policy) 
00448      chunks. This routine allows the setting of maximum number of chunks that 
00449      can be cached, 'maxcache'.
00450 
00451      The performance of the SDxxx interface with chunking is greatly
00452      affected by the users access pattern over the dataset and by
00453      the maximum number of chunks set in the chunk cache. The number chunks 
00454      that can be set in the cache is process memory limited. It is a good 
00455      idea to always set the maximum number of chunks in the cache as the 
00456      default heuristic does not take into account the memory available for 
00457      the application.
00458 
00459      By default when the SDS is promoted to a chunked element the 
00460      maximum number of chunks in the cache 'maxcache' is set to the number of
00461      chunks along the last dimension.
00462 
00463      The values set here affects the current object's caching behaviour.
00464 
00465      If the chunk cache is full and 'maxcache' is greater then the
00466      current 'maxcache' value, then the chunk cache is reset to the new
00467      'maxcache' value, else the chunk cache remains at the current
00468      'maxcache' value.
00469 
00470      If the chunk cache is not full, then the chunk cache is set to the
00471      new 'maxcache' value only if the new 'maxcache' value is greater than the
00472      current number of chunks in the cache.
00473 
00474      Use flags argument of 'HDF_CACHEALL' if the whole object is to be cached 
00475      in memory, otherwise pass in zero(0). Currently you can only
00476      pass in zero.
00477 
00478     See SDsetchunk() for a description of the organization of chunks in an SDS.
00479 
00480 RETURNS
00481      Returns the 'maxcache' value for the chunk cache if successful 
00482      and FAIL otherwise
00483 ******************************************************************************/
00484 HDFLIBAPI intn SDsetchunkcache
00485     (int32 sdsid,     /* IN: sds access id */
00486      int32 maxcache,  /* IN: max number of chunks to cache */
00487      int32 flags      /* IN: flags = 0, HDF_CACHEALL */);
00488 
00489 
00490 #ifdef __cplusplus
00491 }
00492 #endif
